BP.term: negative regulation of membrane protein ectodomain proteolysis

interpro.desc: Tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinase, conserved site

name: TIMP metallopeptidase inhibitor 3

reactome.name: Response to elevated platelet cytosolic Ca2+

summary: This gene belongs to the TIMP gene family. The proteins encoded by this gene family are inhibitors of the matrix metalloproteinases, a group of peptidases involved in degradation of the extracellular matrix (ECM). Expression of this gene is induced in response to mitogenic stimulation and this netrin domain-containing protein is localized to the ECM. Mutations in this gene have been associated with the autosomal dominant disorder Sorsby's fundus dystrophy. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
